intro: Dipogon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plants are shrubs with small, evergreen leaves and produce bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. Dipogon species are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions. They play a role in stabilizing soil in their native habitats and are of interest in ecological and horticultural studies.
